name:
Animal Crossing™: New Leaf
Welcome amiibo
formal_name: Animal Crossing™: New Leaf – Welcome amiibo
description:
Tailor your look, home, and town to create your ideal world, where there’s more to discover than ever! This updated version of the Animal Crossing™: New Leaf game adds in amiibo™ support and a new campground. Invite villagers to camp, get their items, or ask them to move into town using a variety of Animal Crossing series amiibo figures and cards!

Tap Animal Crossing series amiibo figures to invite villagers to the campground! Get their in-game items with MEOW Coupons earned through Town Initiatives. Certain other series of compatible amiibo can be used to summon Nintendo-themed villagers with new items. The 50 Animal Crossing – Welcome amiibo cards can be used to call villagers to camp, and you get one random card if you buy the game at retail. Tap any of the first four series of Animal Crossing amiibo cards to invite villagers to move to your town! Already own Animal Crossing: New Leaf? A new software update on Nintendo eShop adds in this and more, including two action/puzzle games!

If you already own Animal Crossing™: New Leaf, you don’t need to purchase Welcome amiibo version. Please download the free update instead to update your Animal Crossing™: New Leaf to Animal Crossing™: New Leaf – Welcome amiibo version.
disclaimer:
Due to the size of this game, it may take longer to download the digital version of this title when compared to other Nintendo eShop games. At the time of purchase you can choose either “Download Now” to begin to download the game immediately or
“Download Later” to download the game when the system enters “Sleep Mode.”

You may need to upgrade your current SD Card to a compatible SDHC Card or microSDHC Card with enough available space to download this software.
Visit support.nintendo.com for information about storage options. Sold separately.

amiibo™ compatible game (software update may be required). Wii U and New Nintendo 3DS™ XL systems have built-in amiibo support; other systems in the Nintendo 3DS family require a peripheral device (available 2015; sold separately). Compatibility and functionality of amiibo figures may vary per game. Visit http://www.nintendo.com/amiibo/compatibility/ for specific details on how each amiibo works. amiibo sold separately.
